body:
There are 23 more integrations tests are also failing in [Bazel (RBE on :ubuntu: Ubuntu 20.04 LTS)
](https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazel-at-head-plus-downstream/builds/4519#01957915-8ca8-4b2b-bba2-e6f16db07f17),  [Bazel (:windows: Windows)](https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazel-at-head-plus-downstream/builds/4519#01957915-8ca7-42e4-a8dc-70ec474da8b4), [Bazel (:centos: CentOS 7)](https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazel-at-head-plus-downstream/builds/4519#01957915-8ca2-4c80-81cc-ddfe67dae9c0), [Bazel (:ubuntu: Ubuntu 22.04 LTS)](https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazel-at-head-plus-downstream/builds/4519#01957915-8ca3-45c9-8e64-b30b094e141c)

This is caused by my fix being rolled back: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/a4f6814d046e72a638a71b51853901d63658d1f6

@lberki mentioned that he is looking into this

My official opinion is that I have no idea. We clearly can't roll the change forward due to Google-internal reasons and I'm not that convinced that it's the right thing anyway because the concept of "data dependencies for filegroups" is gnarly enough that I'd much rather not have them, but if we have to have them, at least not spend too much time with tweaking its exact semantics.

@fmeum are there alternatives?

@lberki How breaking would the change be if we change the relevant line to
```
                .addRunfiles(ruleContext, RunfilesProvider.DEFAULT_RUNFILES)
```
instead (that is, rather than `DATA_RUNFILES`)? That would match what `srcs` already does. The "data runfiles" part isn't that relevant (especially not for Bazel), it's really just about not swallowing runfiles from deps where `srcs` would not.

I missed to cutoff to run All The Testsâ„¢ yesterday by about a minute and a half, but I kicked it off now. Results should be in in a few hours or depending on the weather, maybe tomorrow morning in the old world.
Meh, fails in the same way (for Googlers: presubmit ID `OCL:739918461:BASE:740219676:1742971999810:52cf4111`)

issue.title: Include `DefaultInfo` in `cquery` `providers` dict

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body: All targets observed from Starlark advertise the `DefaultInfo` provider, but internally that provider is split into `FilesProvider`, `FilesToRunProvider` and `RunfilesProvider`. This is confusing to users that use `cquery` to inspect targets using Starlark expressions. This is improved by synthesizing a `DefaultInfo` provider in the same way as during regular analysis. As a result, the `default_runfiles` and `data_runfiles` of a target can now be inspected with `cquery`.

issue.title: Don't swallow runfiles of `srcs` in data runfiles of `filegroup`

labels.name: team-OSS
labels.description: Issues for the Bazel OSS team: installation, release processBazel packaging, website

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
The `data_runfiles` of a `filegroup` should contain the `data_runfiles` of all deps in `srcs`, plus the `data_runfiles` of all deps in `data`. Previously, they didn't contain the former.

Related to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/25329#issuecomment-2677881350

body: See https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/25365#issuecomment-2754479077, which contains a simplified example that shows what this bug is about. I think that we need to improve the situation, otherwise "binary target gains runfiles" is always going to be a breaking change for Bazel rulesets.

issue.title: Flip `--@bazel_tools//tools/test:incompatible_use_default_test_toolchain`

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Fixes https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/25823

RELNOTES[inc]: `--@bazel_tools//tools/test:incompatible_use_default_test_toolchain` is now enabled by default. All test rules without an explicitly defined `test` exec group now select an execution platform that satisfies all constraints of the target platform. The `--use_target_platform_for_tests` option, which served a similar purpose, is now deprecated. See https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/25823 for more details and migration advice.
